result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristen F Debord was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening  (at least 1x/mth for the first 6mths)
--To make honest and legitimate attempts to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription from licensed physician
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed and mandated
--No possession of hypodermic needles unless medically necessary per treating physician
--No contact with Kristopher Wolff or any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by Agent
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
[MA]Case called at 10:02am
Defendant Kristen F Debord in court, in custody with Attorney John Rhiel  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Ms. Debord

The Court sentences Ms. Debord to a term of imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  16 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  120   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening 
--To make honest and legitimate attempts to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription from licensed physician
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed and only as prescribed
--No possession of hypodermic needles unless medically necessary per treating physician
--No contact with any known drug offenders, except for treatment purposes and  incidental contact for work/education purposes and as deemed appropriate per Agent 
--To pay outstanding statutory costs, fees and surcharges
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 1034
Routed to JA for further review. (MG 11-17-17)

Case called at 11:36 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kristen F Debord in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses the 2nd and subsequent enhancer on Count #1

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; THIS SENTENCE IS STAYED AND IS LEFT TO THE AGENT IF THIS STAY IS TO BE LIFTED - SENTENCE MAY BE SERVED IN WAUKESHA COUNTY IF SERVED
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening (at least 1x/mth for the first 6mths)
--To make honest and legitimate attempts to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription from licensed physician
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed and mandated
--No possession of hypodermic needles unless medically necessary per treating physician
--No contact with Kristopher Wolff or any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $25 drug testing fee

Days credit for time already served: 3 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 12:10 pm

Case called at 10:56am [mo]
[Scheduled for Arraignment]
Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek in court.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, Kristen Debord does NOT appear. 

Atty. Svehlek indicates that she received a message from the COC office that Ms. Debord has vehicle issues and is currently stranded and is attempting to obtain transportation to the Courthouse. 
The Court inquires of the State the reasoning of Cash Bail set at Initial Appearance. 

The Court authorizes a bench warrant body only and STAYS the warrant until tomorrow at 2:00pm.
Shall Ms. Debord fail to appear at tomorrow's hearing, the bench warrant shall be executed and bond be found in default.
recess: 11:01am

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 4:17pm [mo]
Defendant Kristen F Debord in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Officer Matthew Lochowitz -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Teuber
--cross examination by Attorney Svehlek

Arguments given by Atty. Svehlek 
The Court finds probable cause that Ms. Debord committed a felony. The Court binds her over for Trial.

ADA Teuber requests an Arraignment be scheduled
recess: 4:49pm

NEXT:  JA to schedule Arraignment with Counsel

[MK] case called at 1:22pm. 
Defendant Kristen F Debord appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Ms. Debord verifies that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Counsel agree to scheduling the Preliminary Hearing within 11 days, on August 7th. 

The Court requires a $650 cash bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Kristopher Wolf or Jordan Stinger
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--to take all prescription drugs as prescribed
recess 1:28pm. 
[Post-Hearing/off-record, in response to Attorney Svehlek's inquiry, the Court lowered the $750 cash bond amount set on the record to a $650 cash bond requirement. MK]


NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 8/7/15 at 8:30am.
